title: Geth RPC service consistency against other client implementations #1
body:
Hi all,

I am working on a project that validates whether Geth behaves consistently to other Ethereum client implementations against RPC requests. 
(I will refer to the implementations as node A, B and C here.)

I would appreciate it if you can clarify whether the following results are intentional or require patches.

Thank you so much in advance and please let me know if there is anything necessary.

#### System information
Geth version: 1.10.21-stable
OS & Version: Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS
Node.js / web3.js versions: v16.15.0 / v1.7.3

Q1. `getProtocolVersion` support
- (Geth) returns an error: "the method ... not available"
- (Node A,B,C) returns `"0x42"`

Q2. Invalid block argument to `getBlockTransactionCount`
- (Geth) returns `null`
- (Node B) returns an error: "Block ... could not be found"

Q3. Invalid block argument to `getPastLogs`
- (Geth) returns `[]`
- (Node B) returns an error: "... could not be found"

Q4. Invalid block argument to `getTransactionFromBlock`
- (Geth) returns `null`
- (Node B) returns an error: "Block ... could not be found"

Q5. Invalid block argument to `getBlockUncleCount`
- (Geth) returns `null`
- (Node B) returns an error: "Block ... could not be found"

Q6. Invalid block argument to `getUncle`
- (Geth) returns `null`
- (Node B) returns an error: "Block ... could not be found"

Q7. Unknown account to `getProof`
- (Geth) returns an account object
- (Node C) returns an error: "Account not found"

Q8. Wrong range to `getPastLogs`
- (Geth) returns `[]`
- (Node A) returns an error: "end (..) < begin (..)"
- (Node B) returns an error: "'From' block .. later than 'to' block .."

Q9. Wrong range to `getFeeHistory`
- (Geth) returns `{ "oldestBlock": "0x0", "gasUsedRatio": null }`
- (Node B) returns an error: "blockCount: Value 0 is less than 1"
- (Node C) returns an error: "Invalid params"

Q10. Invalid index to `getTransactionFromBlock`
- (Geth) returns `null`
- (Node B) returns an error: "Position Index is incorrect"

Q11. Invalid index to `getUncle`
- (Geth) returns `null`
- (Node B) returns an error: "Position Index is incorrect"

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
1. Please download all the .tar.gz files below.
[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FGUpnQ4WvftxBi7qUp63G3SuhKc-Q1_z/view?usp=sharing](url)
[https://drive.google.com/file/d/1KKuie5iNWIqAdgjcqOSWryCgIpyqwblq/view?usp=sharing](url) 
[test_cases.tar.gz](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/files/9282485/test_cases.tar.gz)
2. Untar the downloaded .tar.gz files. They contain valid chain data and test cases that are semi-automatically generated by our project techniques.
3. Check out DATA_DIR and TC_FILE for your Q{n} from the description below.
4. Execute Geth binary with the following flags:
`geth --datadir DATA_DIR --http --http.api eth --networkid 15 --nodiscover --syncmode full --gcmode archive`
5. Execute the test case file: `node TC_FILE`

- Q1. data-geth-1 / TC_1659703347.js
- Q2. data-geth-1 / TC_1659703298.js
- Q3. data-geth-2 / TC_1659708649.js
- Q4. data-geth-2 / TC_1659708934.js
- Q5. data-geth-1 / TC_1659703459.js
- Q6. data-geth-1 / TC_1659704266.js
- Q7. data-geth-2 / TC_1659709033.js
- Q8. data-geth-2 / TC_1659709328.js
- Q9. data-geth-1 / TC_1659703471.js
- Q10. data-geth-1 / TC_1659703627.js
- Q11. data-geth-2 / TC_1659708317.js
